programme.desc: Matt Hasselbeck threw four touchdown passes and Marshawn Lynch scored on an electrifying 67-yard run with 3:22 left to clinch the first playoff victory by a losing team.

programme.desc: Los Angeles Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert passed for 284 yards and two touchdowns, including a go-ahead 19-yarder to Derius Davis early in the fourth quarter, as the Chargers rallied for a 34-27 victory.

programme.desc: Saquon Barkley dashed through the snow for two touchdown runs and finished with 205 yards rushing, Jalen Hurts had a 44-yard scoring run and the Eagles held on against the turnover-happy Rams 28-22 on Sunday to reach the NFC championship game.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #6: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Masashi Oya is the chip leader ahead of Matthew Wantman, Justin Saliba, Martin Zamani, Jared Jaffee, Ken Aldridge, Anthony Hu, Jesse Lonis, and Dan Shak, as the final nine players play for the $223,100 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 50 players return on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event as Marcel Luske headlines the feature table along with John Murphy. On the outer tables, Josh Arieh and David Williams begin their run up the leaderboard, while previous champions Chris Ferguson and Dan Harrington remain in contention as just 32 players remain.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: There are 32 players remaining on Day 6 of the WSOP Main Event. Chip leader Greg Raymer headlines the feature table along with Josh Arieh and Dan Harrington. The elimination of Chris Ferguson leaves Harrington as the sole Main Event champion remaining, while the field is reduced to just 17 players.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: Watch a replay of the fourth Friday Night Poker cash game! Daniel Negreanu, Jennifer Harman, Frank Kassela, Christian Soto, Kristy Arnett, and Brandon Myers headline an entertaining and action-packed $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action and Daniel Negreanu makes a guest appearance!

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The WSOP Main Event plays down to the final table as former champion Dan Harrington, along with Dutchman Marcel Luske look to make a run at being one of the final nine. Plenty of others will fall short, but who will reach the 2004 WSOP Main Event final table?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The final table of the 2004 WSOP Main Event sees Greg Raymer hold the chip lead ahead of Matt Dean, Josh Arieh, Glenn Hughes, Dan Harrington, David Williams, Al Krux, Mike McLain, and Mattias Andersson. All eyes are on the $5 million first-place pirze and the title of 2004 World Champion.

programme.title: Poker After Dark

programme.title: Poker Masters 2023 | Event #4 $10K No-Limit Hold'em

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.desc: A woman's idyllic world comes crashing down when she's sentenced to life in prison for a crime she didn't commit. She soon finds strength and solace among a group of tight-knit inmates known as the Pretty Girls.

programme.title: Single Black Female

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Well-known rapper Poetic Rhymes goes to jail after a misunderstanding at a bar. He encounters an unusual cell mate that takes control of his mind. After being released from prison, his family notices the changes the hard way.

programme.title: Dream on Dreamer
programme.desc: Mario's life unravels when he quits med school for acting, angering his wife, Erica, who leaves with their daughter. His friend Derrick faces his own crisis with his side chick. Desperate, they turn to Mario's drug-dealing brother, Paul. This leads them into the dangerous world of Queen Pin Malkia, where their lives are put at risk.

programme.title: The Saved and the Salacious
programme.desc: Ashton, Isaac, and Terrell aim for gospel music fame, but clash with Titan Records' shady founder, Rodney.

programme.title: The Only Child

programme.title: The Private Secretary
programme.desc: Married owners of a thriving tech empire bring aboard an elusive private secretary, who has an agenda of her own.

programme.title: The Housekeeper 2
programme.desc: After moving on from her sordid past, Sharease flourishes in her new life and success. When her son Adonis kidnapped, she seeks help from a ghost of her past to rescue him.

programme.title: The House on Adams Drive
programme.desc: Sean is convinced the only way to keep the woman of his dreams happy is by obtaining as much money as possible. His friend Kordell, who's an adult film star, helps him with a way to make a lot of money overnight. When they're sent to a house to possibly film a scene, that turns out to be a real life exorcism.

programme.title: The Special Affect
programme.desc: Expecting mother and artist, Destiny, spirals after a tragic loss. Her loving husband helps her cope, but a bad trip and missed meds spark disturbing memories. With the help of her best friend, Destiny uncovers a horrifying truth about her past.

programme.title: Cut
programme.desc: A claustrophobic thrill ride, only relenting on its increasingly unbearable tension and heart stopping shocks, to inject a little humor to soften the blow and increase the fun!

programme.title: Lines of Allegiance

When he's set up by someone in his crew, he's arrested and sent out of Macon, GA per the judge's order. But when tragedy forces him to return, he finds the people he once cared for, have their own intentions for themselves.

programme.desc: Yancy investigates when several shopkeepers along Duquense Street pay twice as much for what their property is worth, & are subsequently robbed & murdered. He learns that a projected railroad spur is to be built to the waterfront through that shopping district and unscrupulous Northerners plan to use illegal means to grab all the available real estate before the project is officially announced.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: An ambitious housekeeper plans to get control of an elderly rancher's vast estate.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The Lone Ranger and Tonto intervene when three travelers are attacked.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: While visiting a retired marshall, Tonto overhears a violent argument between a wealthy banker and his son.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: An elderly ranch owner tries to show two orphans the error of choosing a life of crime.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: A blind rancher and a 5-year-old child are the only witnesses when outlaws blame a robbery on the Lone Ranger and Tonto.

programme.title: The Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The Lone Ranger and Tonto track two elusive bandits who have been stealing gold shipments.

programme.title: The Stalking Moon
programme.desc: While moving a group of Apaches to a Native American reservation in Arizona, an American scout named Sam Varner (Gregory Peck) is surprised to find a white woman, Sarah Carver (Eva Marie Saint), living with the tribe. When Sam learns that she was taken captive by an Indian named Salvaje ten years ago, he attempts to escort Sarah and her half-Native American son to his home in New Mexico. However, it soon becomes clear that Salvaje is hot on their trail.

programme.title: The Hanging Tree
programme.desc: Joseph "Doc" Frail (Gary Cooper) is a doctor with a past he's trying to outrun. While in Montana, he comes across a mining camp with a hanging tree and rescues a man named Rune (Ben Piazza) from the noose. With Rune as his servant, Frail decides to settle down, and he takes over as town doctor. He meets Elizabeth (Maria Schell), who is suffering from shock, and the two soon fall in love. But when Elizabeth is attacked, Frail's attempt to help her lands them both in trouble.

programme.title: Springfield Rifle
programme.desc: During the Civil War, Union forces stationed in Colorado are hampered by raiders who have been stealing their horses as they travel through the mountains. When several commanding officers begin to suspect a traitor is revealing troop movements, Maj. Lex Kearny (Gary Cooper) goes undercover to investigate. However, the assignment strains Kearny's relationship with his wife, Erin (Phyllis Thaxter), after he chooses to continue the operation instead of searching for their runaway son.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene must apprehend a group of outlaws harassing Pat as he tries to operate a dry-goods store.

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Pat is elected sheriff of Martin County. His first order of business is to arrest the man who shot old mountain man Cliff Miller

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: An elderly old man with diabetes is kidnapped by an employee and his gang

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: Dale buys a stove for her visiting nephew's room from a member of a gang

programme.title: The Roy Rogers Show
programme.desc: A scheme is discovered to rob the local Wells Fargo office

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: Hoppy helps persuade an Indian chief to reveal the location where crude oil can be found on the land's surface before an outsider grabs the land.

programme.title: The Outlaw's Daughter
programme.desc: Kate Dalton (Kelly Ryan), loved by a marshal (Jim Davis), rides off with the outlaw (Bill Williams) who killed her father.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The corrupt businessmen frames Marshal Matt Wayne for murder when he cracks down on crime

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Jeremy Pitt is employed to represent a ship's crew charged with mutiny.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: When beautiful Lola Montez arrives, it causes quite a stir in San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Bandanna Gang is causing a disturbance, so Matt consents to escort some settlers to San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Marshal Wayne suspects fraud when a couple start selling stock in a gold mine.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt gets sworn in as a U.S. marshal when stage holdups occur.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: The Prince of Thieves executes a daring robbery in San Francisco.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: Matt goes sinister Hangtown due to a dying man's last request.

programme.title: The Californians
programme.desc: A gang of thieves tries to frame Corey Harris.

programme.title: San Antonio
programme.desc: Rancher Clay Hardin (Errol Flynn) has discovered that local saloon owner Roy Stuart (Paul Kelly) is selling cattle that doesn't belong to him, including some of Clay's own stolen stock. Armed with a tally book that proves it, Hardin now finds himself the target of Stuart's posse of gunslingers, who will stop at nothing to prevent Hardin from delivering the evidence to the proper authorities. With no one to help him except a few of his friends, Hardin has to fight for his cattle, and his life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tries to do a good deed for the old town drunk but it backfires when the drunk's son believes he inherited Lucas' ranch.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Derringer is falsely accused of complicity in a waterfront property theft. Administer Colton manages to get Matthew Younger to drop the charges, but Yancy discovers the accuser may be throwing charges around to conceal the real perpetrators. His investigations lead him to a waterfront dive and its grave-robbing habitués.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Christmas in New Orleans may not be particularly festive in the Derringer household this year. Nancy learns his Uncle, a government engraver, has been murdered & the plates for the new hundred-dollar bill has disappeared. While Yancy searches for the murderer, his old hound-dog Dixie shows up at his family home proving to be the only one who can lead Yancy to where the family treasure is buried.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Orin and Ruth McKnight's May/December romance hits a rough spot when Bill Longley returns from a cattle drive with news that Orin's son from his first marriage died.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: While sleeping by his campsite, Bill is startled by sounds of movement in the underbrush. He investigates and finds a young boy who is so frightened that he can't talk.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: Bill Longley comes to the aid of Ramirez, a farmer who wants to plant peach trees when the local cattlemen object.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: The $8300 Bill Longley earned for driving a herd of cattle to Mesa isn't in his hands for thirty seconds before two gunmen take his money and the bank's assets as well.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: After Longley is forced to kill a barfly that tried to shoot him in the back, he learns a quirk in the Montana law code.

programme.title: The Texan
programme.desc: While escorting to prison the leader of a notorious gang, a sheriff and a deputy are attacked by the gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is threatened with hanging by a lynch party when some horses he has purchased in a neighboring town turn out to be stolen.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A janitor-turned-gunfighter's reputation hangs on one lucky shot and a lot of gall. The handyman finds himself in trouble when he accidentally kills another gunfighter.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After being foreman of a jury that convicted an Apache, Lucas is marked for death. Now, he must discover who is behind the curse.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas allows some snowed-in stagecoach passengers to stay with him until the roads are passable. Trouble brews when the whisky salesman and gunfighter fall for the same woman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride, using Lucas's name.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas recognizes Dr. Battle as an ex-gunslinger with whom he once fought. He helps with a dying man, but Lucas and the doctor have unresolved anger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A Chinese man and his son fight prejudice as they try to open a laundry in North Fork.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Cattle baron Oat Jackford orders his two cowboys to run Lucas McCain and his son off their ranch.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark gets caught on a mountain ledge, a young outlaw risks his life to rescue him and breaks his leg doing so.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The notorious Shelton rides into the town of North Fork to take revenge on an elderly Marshal who is now crippled and working for Lucas McCain.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Johnny Gibbs, Lucas McCain's brother-in-law, visits the McCain ranch. Gibbs, a rodeo rider wanted by the law, begins stirring up trouble.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A vengeful judge who believes Lucas was responsible for his son's death, kidnaps Mark McCain to revenge himself on Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A new bank opens and Banker Hamilton hires a slow-witted gunman to guard the safe. When some of the gunman's old outlaw friends arrive in town they propose he join them in robbing the bank.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark tries to play Cupid between Lucas and a pretty young stranger who arrives in North Fork, the girl's two older brothers accuse him of trifling with her affections and challenge him to fight them both.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An arch-criminal has been run out of New Orleans and is passing through North Fork. Spotting the McCain ranch, he tells McCain he wants to buy it.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Young Dan Willard takes on Marshal Micah Torrence's job. With no experience, he takes a tough stand with a bunch of Texas cowhands whose high spirits are evident at the saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas gets in trouble when he accuses the foreman of a neighboring ranch of rustling some of his cattle.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An Argentine family moves to North Fork. The townspeople are unfriendly to them, making fun of their clothing and customs. The Argentinean adult immigrant is openly hostile in return.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark find themselves exposed to anthrax after they adopt a stray horse whose owner has been killed in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After the end of the Civil War, General Phil Sheridan, who has been appointed Governor of the New Mexico Territory, is on an inspection tour of the country.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A famous gunfighter marries and decides to retire. He and his wife settle down in North Fork and open a store, but three outlaws arrive in town looking to best him in a gunfight.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: The townsfolk of North Fork decide to give a young couple a shivaree celebration. When the drunken crowd gets out of hand and roughs up the bride-to-be, the young groom challenges them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When a young boy from Brooklyn is accused of murder, Mark, believing the boy's claim of innocence, hides him until he can find the real killer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: U.S. Marshal Sam Buckhart arrives in North Fork in search of renegade Indians suspected of the brutal killing of a Texas Ranger and his family.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Sid Fallon tries to blackmail former gambler Julia Andueza into allowing him to use her boarding house as a gambling hall and saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas puts his life in jeopardy when he agrees to testify in a murder case where the first witness was killed before he could testify, and the killer is still at large.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Dan Maury, released from Yuma prison, arrives in North Fork intent on getting even with Marshal Torrance, who helped send him to jail.

programme.desc: Young Mark McCain is eager to help lawman Jay Jefferson, who has arrived in North Fork intent on killing an outlaw for the reward, whether he is the right man or not.

programme.desc: Lucas comes to the rescue when escaped convicts hold up the general store in North Fork and take Marshall Torrance hostage.

programme.desc: The McCains try to be tolerant of their embittered neighbor Abel MacDonald, but they decide he's gone too far when he won't allow his injured boy to get medical treatment.

programme.desc: An unfounded rumor causes North Fork's outspoken feminist schoolteacher to be attacked by a mob of angry townspeople.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Tim Minchin: So F*****g Rock
programme.desc: Superstar musician and comedian, Tim Minchin brings you So F*****g Rock, Live. Filmed at London’s Bloomsbury Theatre in May 2008. Includes the fan favorites: Inflatable You, Rock 'n Roll Nerd, Peace Anthem for Palestine, Canvas Bags and loads more!

programme.title: Myq Kaplan: Small, Dork and Handsome
programme.desc: Wise guy Myq Kaplan is Small, Dork and Handsome. The might of Myq's manic comedy machine is sure to stupefy and amuse as he describes his skewed spin on the oddities of life. Filmed live in Boston.

programme.title: Moshe Kasher: Live in Oakland
programme.desc: Back on his home turf Oakland-bred comic and best-selling author, Moshe Kasher, finds comedy in uproarious stories about the people he's met and how they see him.

programme.title: Matt Bergman: Mostly Nice
programme.desc: A mixture of new material sprinkled with some favorites from DC comedian Matt Bergman filmed in Dallas, Texas.

programme.title: Sklar Brothers: Hipster Ghosts
programme.desc: Performing in Chicago, the Sklar Brothers tackle topics such as politics, parenting, canine racism, and who might haunt us in the afterlife.

programme.title: Josh Blue: Sticky Change
programme.desc: Quipster Josh Blue hits the stage where he turns his cerebral palsy and cross-cultural marriage into comedy gold.

programme.title: Natalia Valdebenito: Gritona
programme.desc: Comic Natalia Valdebenito explores topics once considered taboo in Latin America.

programme.title: Jose Velasquez Hoozay: The Salvadoran
programme.desc: From his mom’s backyard to the big stage, Jose "Hoozay" Velasquez is taking the comedy world by storm with his heartwarming, hysterical storytelling.

programme.title: Pablo Francisco: Ouch! Live From San Jose!
programme.desc: ‘MADtv’ favorite Pablo Francisco shares hot takes on movies, music, celebrities, video games, obnoxious body piercings, and more in this comedy set.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: The comedian and his puppets perform in the gorgeous Dolby Theatre, featuring hilarious sketches with surprise guests and lots of laughs.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Chris Porter: A Man From Kansas
programme.desc: Kansas-based comedian Chris Porter’s comedy set about men’s very limited emotions, people who think the Earth is flat, and hipsters ruining food.

programme.title: Dan Cummins: Don't Wake The Bear
programme.desc: Unabashedly tackling any subject from gun control laws to raising a child that is clearly smarter than you, Dan Cummins unloads some of his funniest material to date! Filmed over two sold-out shows at the historic Salt Lake City venue.

programme.title: Godfrey: Regular Black
programme.desc: The hilarious, fearless comic discusses college, public transportation, and more in this comedy special performed in his hometown of Chicago.

programme.title: Sarah Hester Ross: Don't Mess With a Redhead
programme.desc: In this original music-packed special, the comedian shows you what it's like to be TikTok famous, not wanting babies, and much more.

programme.title: Nick Alexander Presents Nick Alexander
programme.desc: Nick Alexander marks his debut special, as he performs a coming-of-age set highlighting boyhood, his Haitian upbringing, relationships, depression, the pandemic, and everything in between while celebrating his birthday.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: I Can Laugh About It Now
programme.desc: The comedian discusses his life’s difficulties including addiction, bankruptcy, and how to overcome tragedy by making lemonade out of lemons.

programme.title: Jeff Allen: Honor Thy Wife
programme.desc: The laugh-out-loud funny stand up comedian focuses his special on the hilarious highs and relatable lows of everyday married life.

programme.title: Ryan James: I'm Fine
programme.desc: Ryan James goes deep with a set where he takes all the things most people don’t tell anyone and puts himself out there as truthfully as he can.

programme.title: Steve Hofstetter: A Trip to Japan
programme.desc: Often called the "hardest working man in show-business," Steve covers everything from paper decapitations in plane crashes to seeing-eye children.

programme.title: Traffic Jam Comedy Jam: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Marc Brissett teams up with Talent Da Comedian for hilarious standup comedy featuring Divine and Aldo Marachlian.

programme.title: Zoltan Kaszas: Cat Jokes
programme.desc: Born in Budapest, Hungary and raised in San Diego, California, this comic first stepped onstage at the age of 19 and was hooked immediately.

programme.title: Ryan Erwin: Full Time Quitter
programme.desc: Ryan Erwin looks at his inability in keeping a regular job; Erwin hilariously informs a sold-out Utah crowd why the job they're watching him do is the only one he's able to keep.

programme.title: Willie Barcena: The Truth Hurts
programme.desc: Stand-up comic Willie Barcena’s hilarious special, filmed in El Paso, bluntly questions everything from religion and dating to ladies with big feet.

programme.title: Erik Terrell: Live at Helium Comedy Club
programme.desc: Named one of Variety magazine’s “Comics to Watch,” here’s Erik Terrell in a hilarious stand-up set delivered at his “home club” in Philly.

programme.title: Keep Your Distance: Vol. 16
programme.desc: KevOnStage hosts a night of stand-up comedy featuring Tony Valentino and Brennon Edwards.

programme.title: Dan Naturman: A Little Bit Bananas
programme.desc: Dan Naturman delivers a barrage of observational comedy about marriage, Amazon Prime, the unimpressive nature of being an uncle and life's hypocrisies.

programme.title: Tom Papa: Live in New York City
programme.desc: With a shiny happy exterior, an offbeat, demented interior and direction from Rob Zombie, Tom Papa’s “Live In New York City” attacks our hilarious attempts at happiness as life piles up around us. He jokes about becoming a parent, family pets, and boundaries for technology.

programme.title: Saul Trujillo: Yolanda
programme.desc: Does Variety's 'top comic to watch’ look like Selena's murderer? Find out why cruises are terrible and the homeless tent problem isn't what we think.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join the team as they present the seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Adam Frost presents from his garden and suggests essential gardening jobs for the weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the borders at Longmeadow hit their stride, it's time to take stock of what's looking good and what needs replacing. Monty shares his tips on how to keep the display going all summer long. There's plenty to do on the vegetable plot too and things are looking promising in the fruit garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her very first garden for a summer catch-up and an update on her progress since moving in. Meanwhile, Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants for pollinators in the Wildlife Garden and trims his box topiary cones. He also takes succulent leaf cuttings and continues the summer veg harvest. Meanwhile, Carol Klein visits stunning Italian-influenced gardens in Gloucestershire.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to take cuttings from herbs, prune summer raspberries and plant daylilies. Meanwhile, Adam travels to Whitstable on the Kent coast to see how gardeners cope with the wild, wet and windy weather.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn just around the corner, Adam takes stock of his garden and plans ahead for some late-season interest under the supervision of Ash the cat. Plus, Frances visits a garden in Kent where the plants provide a non-stop buffet for insects.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants bulbs in pots, including hyacinths and daffodils. He shares tips and advice on what to do when apples and pears have been affected by diseases such as canker and brown rot. Plus, he gives a timely guide on how to collect and save seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles autumn lawn maintenance tasks, Carol Klein is looking at burnets, and we meet a man who's dedicated himself to a North American prairie favourite, the echinacea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost gives tips on lawn repair, grows some unusual vegetables and plants a seasonal container. Advolly Richmond brings us up to date in her history of lawns by exploring the trend for ever more sophisticated machinery.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty turns his attention to his ornamental grass borders, Carol travels to Cheshire to view some heleniums, and Joe is treated to a Jamaican feast when he visits Moor Green Allotments in Birmingham.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty revels in the sweet peas he grew from seed earlier in the year and shows how to keep their display going on into the weeks ahead. Meanwhile, Rachel meets a couple from Hampshire who have created their entire garden around their obsession for one plant, the hosta. Elsewhere, Carol travels to Wales to find out how one man tackled his sloping plot to make a garden on five different levels.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty considers a revamp of his cottage garden, divides perennials to get new plants for free and plants bulbs in pots for spring.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A virtual explosion of color as Bob Ross paints blazing orange and gold trees below a ridge of magnificent mountain peaks.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A painting to reflect the essence of fall, bursting forth in a profusion of brilliant colors as Bob Ross creates a haven of tranquility on canvas.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a spectacular warm winter painting where snow-covered mountains, trees and bushes lend an alluring sense of beauty in an oval.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Happen upon this sweet cabin in the woods; Bob Ross paints a time-forgotten treasure that comes to life in a soft, warm landscape scene.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross presents a really unique idea using black gesso -- two lovely paintings in one -- summer and winter scenes overlapping on the same canvas!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Take a nice walk with Bob Ross along a peacefully flowing river and enjoy a view of gorgeous amethyst mountains and stately trees in the distance.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that we’ve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time we’ve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we dive into how we are using our knowledge and experience to not only get some amazing hunting property, but to have other people pay for it. Sound too good to be true? We also take you on some great hunts we’ve had on our journey flipping land and think back on some memories from the past and what the future is going to look like. We hope you can learn a thing or two in this episode and encourage you to reach out with any questions you may have about this process.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are back in Missouri on our new farm that we’ve recently purchased. We developed our last farm, and did a 1031 tax free exchange to buy this farm so we can develop and sell it later on. This is the first time we’ve seen the property, so we are finding out what we are going to do with it and how we are going to lay it out. Once we get that figured out, we go into the dirty work of planting, moving box stands, and making sure everything is good for hunting season. Fast forward and we have two amazing hunts where both Ryan and myself take awesome bucks with our bows. This one has it all! Do not miss it!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Intrigo: Death of an Author
programme.desc: An author plots the murder of his wife - but her body is never found, and he’s convinced she’s still alive.

programme.title: Gone
programme.desc: A woman who escaped a serial killer searches for him herself after her sister is abducted and the police refuse to believe it’s a connected crime.

programme.title: Uninvited Guest
programme.desc: A couple let a man in to their home to use the phone, but he's a deranged fugitive wanted for murder.

programme.title: With Honors
programme.desc: A homeless man holds a stuffy Ivy League student's misplaced graduate thesis hostage in return for room and board - one page for every day.

programme.title: Elvis: That's The Way It Is (Special Edition)
programme.desc: This feature-length concert film crosses the footlights to reveal the King of Rock and Roll’s triumphant 1970 return to the stage in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Imagine: John Lennon
programme.desc: A film documenting John Lennon's profound impact on the world via footage shot during Lennon's life.

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix
programme.desc: In this riveting documentary, Hendrix's family and close friends, joined by rock legends, present their memories of the greatest rock guitarist ever.

programme.title: Fame
programme.desc: Students at New York's High School of Performing Arts hope to make it big.

programme.title: Moving
programme.desc: A mass-transit engineer faces the horrors of relocating his family from his lifelong home in New Jersey when he’s offered a dream job in Boise, Idaho.

programme.title: Memoirs Of An Invisible Man
programme.desc: A nuclear accident turns a successful businessman invisible - a change that proves more of a burden than gift.

programme.title: The Mummy Lives
programme.desc: An ancient mummy returns from the dead and becomes obsessed with a woman he believes is his dead lover.

programme.title: The Dukes of Hazzard: The Beginning
programme.desc: This comedy prequel contains wild car chases and crashes, Daisy's hilarious hijinks, and a bevy of laughs.

programme.title: Home Fries
programme.desc: A pregnant worker at a fast-food joint becomes the irresistible target of a young man, whose homicidal family wants her dead.

programme.title: Harlem Globetrotters: The Team That Changed the World
programme.desc: This entertaining sports documentary explores the Harlem Globetrotters' social and cultural impact.

programme.title: Mr. Nanny
programme.desc: A retired wrestler must survive an impossible job when becomes the nanny to kids whose favorite game is finding ways to force their nanny to quit.

programme.title: Osmosis Jones
programme.desc: Inside the body of a zoo worker, a white-blood-cell cop and a cold tablet join forces to stop a virulent virus that’s intent on taking over The City.

programme.title: Mr. Wonderful
programme.desc: An electrical worker hopes his ex-wife will remarry - until he finds himself falling back in love with her.

programme.title: Sound of Thunder, A
programme.desc: In the future, time travel is possible, as a travel agency escorts wealthy clients into the Prehistoric Era.

programme.title: Three To Tango
programme.desc: An architect pretends to be gay to win a job opportunity, but the ploy may cause him to lose his ideal woman.

programme.title: Stealing Home
programme.desc: A former professional baseball player must confront the choices he has made—or avoided—when he returns to his hometown for a personal matter.

programme.title: Night Shift
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck financial planner meets a fast-talking loser at the New York City morgue.

programme.title: Switching Channels
programme.desc: A news anchor and journalist wants to escape the humiliation of the newsroom, but her conniving ex-husband won't let her leave so easily.

programme.title: Now Is Good
programme.desc: Given a few months to live, Tessa—unleashed from all conventions—pursues a bucket list that makes her feel more alive than she ever thought possible.

programme.title: Peggy Sue Got Married
programme.desc: An unhappy woman named Peggy Sue tries to change her future when she inadvertently travels back in time to her senior year of high school.

programme.title: Dear Eleanor
programme.desc: During the chaos of the Cuban Missile Crisis, a pair of teenage girls travels across America in search of former First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette
programme.desc: Complete with lavish imagery, this is the story of France's iconic, ill-fated teenage queen, whose rule coincided with the fall of Versailles.

programme.title: Passionada
programme.desc: When a widowed mother refuses to date even years after her husband's death, her daughter Vicky sets out on a quest to find romance for her mom.

programme.title: Punchline
programme.desc: Steve, a broke stand-up comedian, develops a friendship and mentorship with Lilah, a homemaker with an ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

programme.title: The Razor's Edge
programme.desc: A WWI veteran is disillusioned by jazz-age values. He breaks off his engagement and goes on a journey that takes him through Paris and the Himalayas.

programme.title: Faith of My Fathers
programme.desc: This adaptation of John McCain's best-selling autobiography chronicles his experiences as a Navy pilot and five years as a POW in North Vietnam.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wife’s divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew in WWII must contend with thirsty Nazi troops while crossing the Sahara in search of a fabled water well.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: Solo
programme.desc: A powerful government killing machine with the appearance of a man carries out a series of missions. Soon, this being starts to grow a conscience.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: Armored guards are supposed to ensure no money gets stolen but when a team of guards’ plans for a heist go wrong, they begin to betray each other.

programme.title: Three on a Couch
programme.desc: An artist hopes to move to Paris, but his psychiatrist fiancée fears abandoning her patients, so he dons various disguises to cure the lonesome women.

programme.title: Phffft!
programme.desc: A divorced couple hopes to move on after their split, but fate has other plans. They’re dating other people, but they keep running into each other!

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: This steamy pot-boiler follows the intrigues surrounding an escaped convict who attempts to return to the small southern town where he grew up.

programme.title: Boots Malone
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck jockey's agent takes a wealthy, yet neglected kid under his wing, and, with the help of others, turns him into a champion.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: Salome
programme.desc: Salome tries to save John the Baptist from losing his head to the sword of King Herod, reversing the story that she was responsible for his death.

programme.title: Brief Moment
programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: All the King's Men
programme.desc: This Academy Award winner for Best Picture tells the story of an idealistic Southern politician brought down by his own ambition and lust for power.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Bad for Each Other
programme.desc: Wooed by a Pittsburgh socialite, an idealistic doctor from a mining town is torn between helping his community and lucrative work at an elite clinic.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: The Fuller Brush Girl
programme.desc: Fired from her job as a switchboard operator, a daffy young woman tries her hand at door-to-door cosmetics sales only to get mixed up in a murder rap.

programme.title: Walk, Don't Run
programme.desc: During the Olympics, an electronics expert learns his hotel room will not be available for two days, and is forced to share an apartment with a woman.

programme.title: It Should Happen to You
programme.desc: A young model finds her dreams of fame coming true when she rents billboards in New York to advertise herself, attracting fans and two rival suitors.

programme.title: The Bridge on the River Kwai
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Pierre Bouelle novel about POWs in Burma forced to build a bridge to aid the war effort of their Japanese captors. British and American officers plot to blow up the structure, but the commander of the bridge's construction has different plans.

programme.title: Tulsa
programme.desc: When a rancher dies during a feud with a big oil company, his daughter takes revenge by digging her own wells, assisted by an expert and a friend.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Terror Trail
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) heads off a range war over cattle and sheep.

programme.title: Blackjack Ketchum, Desperado
programme.desc: A gunfighter (Howard Duff) wants peace in the valley, but a cattle baron (Victor Jory) and his brothers want war.

programme.title: They Came to Cordura
programme.desc: On a mission to Mexico, U.S. Maj. Tom Thorn (Gary Cooper) is branded a coward, while several of his fellow servicemen are praised for showing bravery. Tom is asked to transport the heroes through harsh terrain so they can be honored. Also along for the journey is Adelaide Geary (Rita Hayworth), a woman charged with conspiring against the United States. But, as his fellow soldiers begin revealing their treacherous sides, Tom realizes that Adelaide is the only heroic one of the bunch.

programme.title: Alvarez Kelly
programme.desc: Alvarez Kelly (William Holden) is a Mexican cattle rancher who is doing his best to stay out of the Civil War. He has no interest in which side may win or lose -- Kelly is far more concerned about his own survival, and about making money. He soon finds himself in the middle of the conflict, however, when a confederate colonel (Richard Widmark) captures the rancher and forces Kelly to help his soldiers steal a nearby herd of cattle, which they desperately need for food.

programme.title: The Wild Westerners
programme.desc: A U.S. marshal (James Philbrook) and his wife (Nancy Kovack) bring Union gold east through outlaws and Indians.

programme.title: Dirty Little Billy
programme.desc: After his family moves to a frontier town in Kansas, city-bred teenager Billy Bonney (Michael J. Pollard) finds he has no appetite for farming. He runs away, taking up with local outlaw Goldie (Richard Evans), who operates a saloon in town with the help of a prostitute named Berle (Lee Purcell). The three form a gang of sorts, menacing the locals until the townsfolk collectively decide to drive the outlaws away. Bonney escapes and begins the life of crime that makes him famous as Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: Two-Fisted Law
programme.desc: After Tim Clark's ranch is stolen by Bob Russell, he discovers that the crook is also trying to cheat his lover out of her land.

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A banished gunfighter (Audie Murphy) returns to his sweetheart (Merry Anders) and helps his sheriff friend (James Best) face outlaws.

programme.title: The Nebraskan
programme.desc: When his Indian assistant, Wingfoot (Maurice Jara), is accused of murdering a Sioux chief, Army scout Wade Harper (Phil Carey) brings him to Fort Kearney, Neb., where Colonel Markham (Regis Toomey) insists the young man has the right to a fair trial rather than handing him over to the Sioux. While in jail, Wingfoot is forced to escape with ruthless prisoner Reno Benton (Lee Van Cleef). Wade sets out with a small party to rescue his friend, with the Sioux right behind him.

programme.title: Count Three and Pray
programme.desc: After fighting for the Union during the Civil War, Luke Fargo (Van Heflin) is greeted with resentment when he returns home to his small southern town. Luke has a reputation as a rogue, but he's reinvented himself as a man of God and plans to fix up the town's damaged church. Recalling their romantic past, Georgina Decrais (Allison Hayes) tries to reclaim Luke. But, to the dismay of some suspicious townspeople, he concentrates on mentoring an unsophisticated young woman, Lissy (Joanne Woodward).

programme.title: Oklahoma Crude
programme.desc: An oil derrick owner in early 1900s Oklahoma, along with her father and a bum, tries her best to keep oil companies from buying her estate.

programme.title: Al Jennings of Oklahoma
programme.desc: Lawyer Al (Dan Duryea) and brother Frank (Dick Foran) turn to robbing banks and trains after Union troops raid their home.

programme.title: Good Day for a Hanging
programme.desc: When the local sheriff is killed after a bank robbery, ex-lawman Ben Cutler (Fred MacMurray) collars the apparent killer, Eddie Campbell (Robert Vaughn). Because of his background as a local youth who spent time living with the Cutlers, Eddie gets the benefit of the doubt from Ben's daughter and his wife-to-be, Ruth (Margaret Hayes). Ben is firm in his belief that Eddie is guilty, and as the matter is debated in a divisive court battle, it will soon become clear whether or not he's right.

programme.title: Ride Beyond Vengeance
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Al Dewlen.

programme.title: Relentless

programme.desc: The Falcon and a reporter try to track down a murderous thug's girlfriend.

programme.desc: The BAU team heads to Portland, Ore., to investigate a chilling abduction that may be linked to a local couple who were killed in their home a week earlier.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team flies to Iowa to investigate the disappearance of three 10-year-old children who appear to have been abducted from their homes, with surveillance video from a park as their only lead to finding the children's whereabouts.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Rossi questions his actions in the aftermath of a struggle with a serial killer who appears to have outsmarted the BAU.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates a string of murders taking place in supposedly haunted houses in Lewiston, Maine.

programme.desc: The team searches for Everett Lynch and his daughter; Spencer has a meaningful visit with his mother.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU team investigates a series of seemingly random fatal explosions throughout Kentucky and Tennessee.

programme.desc: The members of the BAU enjoy a Saturday off in vastly different ways; Rossi and Prentiss help Simmons assemble a new crib; Garcia leads a hacking competition; Dr. Reid strikes up a conversation with a woman named Maxine.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Following a series of fatal shootings, the BAU team travels to Illinois to investigate what appears to be a copycat serial killer.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After a father and daughter get kidnapped, a former foe of the BAU returns with very specific demands for Dr. Reid.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When the BAU team travels to Denver to investigate several murders, Prentiss is forced to evaluate her relationship with Special Agent Andrew Mendoza.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Prentiss and J.J. are faced with important decisions to make about their futures as the BAU travels to Texas to investigate a series of murdered businessmen.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Chance is charged with the death of Jacob Calder's illegitimate son, Danny, to avenge Burton Hardesty's death.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Chance Bowman and Jesse James Rader try to save federal agent Cie Baxter, who has been kidnapped by Jacob Calder.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Chance and Jacob Calder form an unusual union after Chance finds Calder was not responsible for his wife's death.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Chance (Lucky Vanous) must rescue Cie Baxter (Lisa Thornhill) when she goes under cover to catch a killer of lap dancers.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion has little hope for rescue after their plane crash-lands on a remote, deserted island while en route to Toby and Happy's honeymoon.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Tensions run high for members of Team Scorpion when they must overcome personal conflicts to be rescued from the desert island they crashlanded on three weeks earlier.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must work with their old nemesis Mark Collins to prevent the extinction of mankind; Walter and Paige awkwardly navigate their new relationship.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion continues work with their nemesis to prevent humanity's extinction; Cabe's last-minute decision while on the case endangers his career.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: When poachers almost kill a pregnant deer, the team tries to save the deer and the fawn; Happy and Toby discuss the future of their family.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: While decommissioning an old nuclear missile, an accident causes the team to endure exposure to toxic vapor while trying to prevent the nuke from detonating; Paige confronts Happy about constantly tagging along with her and Walter.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: While attending a tech convention, Team Scorpion is taken hostage by a group attempting a virtual heist.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: At Halloween, the team takes on a case to prove the existence of ghosts on the Queen Mary but find a ship on a deadly collision course; Walter considers taking note of Paige's interests to benefit their relationship.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team helps Cam solve the case of an unidentified boy; after making personal discoveries, the members of the team realize they belong in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The remains of a couple are found in a cave; Brennan re-evaluates her relationship with Booth when his girlfriend makes a surprise visit.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth head to the Jersey Shore when decomposed remains are discovered; the team becomes fond of Booth's girlfriend; Angela tries to keep a secret.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When a skull and decomposing hands are found in a dumpster, the team searches for the rest of the victim's remains; Brennan agrees to shoot an episode of a children's show with professor Bunsen, "The Science Dude" Jude (David Alan Grier).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The skull of a promising young dancer is discovered at a construction site; Hannah's safety is jeopardized when an assignment takes her to a dangerous part of town.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Human remains from a 150-year-old slave ship surface; the investigation leads Booth and Brennan to a cruise where a murder victim was seen moments before his death.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: No one could suspect that a prestigious golf club would be the setting for murder, but when one of the major members is found dead, bludgeoned to death in a thicket next to the 13th hole, Barnaby and Jones try to determine what made him leave the fairway. It seems the club has a rift between the snobbish members, and local villagers, the latter only allowed onto the course for a few hours a week. Before long, another member turns up dead, and the detectives soon find the club has a hidden history, involving gambling, illegal money lending and assault, prompting the pair to determine if a club member, or one of its staff, is responsible for the deeds.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A newly discovered masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for £400,000 - just hours before its former owner is tortured and killed. When another Hogson is stolen, Barnaby decides to become an expert on the Midsomer painter, with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms (Susannah Harker). He soon realises the paintings are not what they seem - but the death toll is rising.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Former secret agent Geoffrey Larkin arrives in Midsomer Parva and stays at Allenby House, a country mansion run by former spies Sir Malcolm Frazer (Benjamin Whitrow), his son Nicky (Peter Davison) and Nicky's wife Jenny (Alice Krige) as a safe house. Geoffrey is soon gashed to death after a cricket match in Midsomer Parva, and the locals blame the 'beast of Midsomer'. However, Barnaby - a former spy himself - soon realises that the killing has links to Allenby House and Cold War Berlin, but is initially thrown off the case by MI6. But when a further murder occurs MI6 Agent Glen Jarvis (Neil Stuke) asks Barnaby back on the case.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer University science fellow and cycling enthusiast George Jeffers (David Haig) threatens to make public a problem with his state-of-the-art invention Kernel Logic, but American software boss Clinton Finn fears he will lose millions if the truth comes out. When a schoolteacher is killed in a hit-and-run, Barnaby suspects Jeffers was the intended target. The subsequent murder of a fellow cyclist (Philip Jackson) brings the involvement of fellow University associates (Jonathan Cecil and Jim Norton) into sharper focus.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the peaceful village of Little Worthy, Bob Moss was about to open up his beloved model village, when he found a gruesome extra attraction. Young local, Richard Tanner, had been stabbed in the side and his corpse tied down like Gulliver in Lilliput. Barnaby and Jones wonder who wanted him dead, but when the woman he was secretly meeting is killed during the village's Crazy Craft race, the pair have to delve in and discover who might be lying and hiding secrets.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A cat burglar is on the loose, one known as "the Creeper", but the wave of burglaries he or she have committed, seem to have finally led to murder, when David Roper (Rik Mayall) is found smothered in his bed on the Chettham family estate. Yet Barnaby and Jones learn he may have been planning to write a book that could have been quite uncomfortable for someone, leading the pair to determine whether members of the Chettham family, or their friends, were responsible.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A sleep-walking school teacher (Nancy Carroll) starts to believe she has slit the throats of her mentor (Tim Wylton) and a local handyman man in her sleep, but her friends (Paola Dionisotti and Monica Dolan) are not convinced that she is the culprit, nor is Barnaby. A local philanthropist (Paul Chapman) and his social-climbing wife (Suzanne Burden) are planning the annual Frobisher night - but will it go without a hitch, and can they identify the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddington’s thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure they’re never dethroned…

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Poison: Breaking The Band
programme.desc: In the 1980s, metal band Poison were united in their determination to become rock stars. Through hard work and relentless promotion, they did indeed take the world by storm. Their off-stage excess and partying, along with their female following, was legendary. Festering jealousies and power struggles, worsening addictions, gladiatorial backstage fist fights and ultimately burnout from constant touring and partying were amongst the trials they faced.. So which of these ended up poisoning Poison?
