programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy brings his son to Moreno Valley, where good things always happen, and leaves with yo-yo's of an unexpected kind; Rene and Casey discover that their shoes are more "air" and less "Jordan."

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny treats Perris, Calif., like a European vacation, picking up women along the way; Jarrod's lousy locker doesn't offer him any protection; Rene's tools end up being older than he expects.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The gang is on final approach in Riverside; Darrell listens to his sports sense, and it pays off; Ivy and Ivy get distracted by a decoy but manage to find the bills in the end; Brandi tries to teach Danielle a lesson about the true meaning of trash.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Everything seems like business as usual in West Covina, Calif., until a crazy-looking vintage Mercury Zephyr pulls up, revealing an old friend; Darrell and his buddy stumble over the ultimate sketch artist; Ivy and his son can't seem to pick a lane.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A confident Kenny has a three-step plan for success in Stanton, Calif.; Darrell helps Kimber find winning items for her new boutique; Rene brings Casey, who needs a distraction; Laura takes lead as auctioneer, while Dan holds the clipboard.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny's fear of sharks inspires a controversial wardrobe choice; Rene brings his bargain army along to try and intimidate the competition while he gets his slice of the loot; Darrell won't take no for an answer, moving full-steam ahead.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Lisa decides to be fact-based in Placentia, Calif., inadvertently complicating international relations; Ivy and his son conjure up a locker with some mysterious sports equipment; Rene won't be taken advantage of, allowing him to record a nice win.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi does everything she can to stay positive; Darrell finds a unit with some vintage totes, while Gunter plays on Rene's last nerve.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: A small animal catches Lisa off guard, though she does snag a new type of prize; Ivy and Isaiah barrel their way through a unit, leaving them in need of a drink; Darrell keeps getting stuck behind an old lady.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: It's a hot one in Moreno Valley, with temperatures reaching the 100s; Kenny fights the heat by providing everyone with popsicles; Rene brings along his daughter, Tatiana, who needs a math lesson or two; both of Ivy's sons lend a helping hand.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Laura takes the reigns alone in Fullerton and proceeds to outsell Dan; Brandi gets assaulted by her locker but ultimately drives home a winner; Rene postpones a day date in favor of a work date; Darrell stumbles across an unexpected collection.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene shows up in Orange, declaring himself the king, while Dusty isn't quite ready to concede the title; Kenny accidentally reinvents the wheel; Lisa sees things from a slightly different perspective.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell has to deal with Kimber's eyes on a competitor; Ivy brings a full truck, hoping for a second haul; Dusty unpacks what could be the ultimate assistant; Rene's hunch serves him well, putting together one of his greatest profits.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interview her cousin, JD. Willie is hesitant at first, but immediately hits it off with JD, who truly appreciates Willie's sense of humor.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old GI Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms.Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse."

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition is taken to a whole new level when Jase and Willie challenge Alan and Jep to a survival race through the woods on Phil's property.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Phil discovers more beaver activity on the Robertson land, he recruits Jase, Jep, and Si to get rid of them. Meanwhile, Willie and Korie bring Bella to her first day of karate practice.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1956 Ford truck has been sitting in a barn for more than 30 years; Joe and his crew fab up a hand-built custom frame, drop in a big power plant and make the interior smell like new leather.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew welds, grinds and hammers the frame and chassis of the barn-find '56 Ford truck; Joe uses all his tricks to make it look like it has been parked in a field for more than 50 years, but drive like a modern muscle machine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew sinks their teeth into a legendary '77 Bandit Trans Am; a car of this stature calls for a big motor, meaty tires, low stance, steel spoilers, killer paint job and a brand-new interior; a '67 Chevelle returns for a supercharger engine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is deep into the rebuild of a '77 Bandit Trans Am; the car has a new frame, updated suspension and a new LS motor, but the T-Top is totally janky; it needs strengthening before this classic muscle car can get roaring down the road again.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew checks another iconic car off their bucket list when they transform an iconic '70 Chevelle into a drag car. They make it MEAN with a monster motor, big tires, trick frame and a roll cage. But Joe dreams up a chopped roof at the 11th hour.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: It's open-car surgery as Joe and the team work to realize his dream of a cold-blooded '70 Chevelle race car with a chopped roof. Complications with the modified roof arise when the big-block monster motor obstructs driver visibility.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe stumbles across a '64 Ford Galaxie in great shape with only 60,000 miles on it. For Joe, it isn't enough to restore it to 1964, which means a trick frame with all-new steering, tires and a Coyote engine that will really make the car blast off.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Three years after a unicorn first rolled into the shop, Joe is more determined than ever to honor a 1936 Hudson owner's dying wishes to bring the car back to life; the ultimate Iron Resurrection will put Joe's exceptional metal skills to the test.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: In this corner, weighing in at only 2,400 pounds, the 1965 Ford Falcon! For a former professional wrestler, there isn't a better 50th birthday present than restoring this cult classic. For that, he puts his trust in Joe Martin & his world-class team.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A former customer has returned to the shop with a new project, a 1950 5-window Chevy truck. This isn't just any car in his collection, it's the crown jewel. To Joe's horror, this prized possession might have some seriously unsalvageable damage.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin puts the finishing touches on the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and arranges for the car to be delivered to the owner; Joe uses all his tricks to prepare a Chevrolet C10 for a charity auction with a stylish paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe dusts off his prized '65 Pontiac Catalina to give it the facelift it deserves -- new brakes, new trick frame and a bigger, badder LSA 600 horsepower motor. Meanwhile, Martin Bros. Customs tricks out the interior on an iconic 1932 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer from New York entrusts Joe with his prized 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew button up the 1965 Riviera's wiring, interior and paint.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The mayhem is back complete with its new 707hp drivetrain from a 2015 Dodge Charger Hellcat; the off-road Hornet; the Disgustang; the Crusher Impala; time for big action.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan built (or unbuilt) the Vette Kart: an '85 Chevy Corvette stripped to nothing but a chassis and powertrain; now, it's back and the guys try to execute the least-predictable stunt ever.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: For years Mike has wanted to build a 200-mph Cadillac, and now David has finally agreed to make it happen; they purchase a 1961 bubbbletop Cadillac deVille in Northern California; a Cadillac 500 engine wrapped inside a '73 AMC Gremlin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike merge the front halves of two four-wheel-drive vehicles.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike attempt to fill the Mazdarati void with their new Econorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Steve built the Super Sammy, a junkyard-rescued Suzuki Samurai that they crammed a 440 Chrysler big-block into right where it sat in the middle of the junkyard; now they're back to find out why Suzuki never offered this engine combination.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike consider themselves masters of burnout-ology; yet they have never actually entered a burnout competition until now; they take a rusted-out '76 Camaro and set out across Texas to show how to scientifically get the best burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1964 Ford Galaxie 500 XL that absolutely needed to be rescued; after a few miles, the car begins to smoke worse than any car in the history of Roadkill.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike find beaters under $3K; it's a four-vehicle shootout with Chevy vs. Ford, truck vs. car, and old vs. newer; Freiburger chose a 2006 Crown Vic and a 1999 Chevy S-10; Finnegan went vintage with a 1972 Ford Maverick and a 1976 Chevy LUV.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys return to a parking lot to swap out the engine in a '74 Jag XJ12.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and David drive a new car every day as they trade their way through the 25th Hot Rod Power Tour; each day, they'll swap their junk for someone else's and try to make it to the next stop on the tour.

programme.title: Roadkill

programme.title: Roadkill

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth are finally getting married! They've been together for more than ten years but Dog is determined, as he puts it, to "marry his common law wife the Christian way." There are big nuptials planned on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog is back in Hawaii confronted with two alleged felons who are in crisis. Family and friends of these bondees are convinced that they are getting into further trouble while awaiting trial.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's latest fugitive, doesn't think small when it comes to illegal drugs: he was carrying almost a pound of methamphetamine when he was arrested. Now he's on the run with his pregnant girlfriend on the high plains of Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog usually takes his job personally, but this time a case really hits home. First, he and Beth receive a special gift--a painting of Dog's recently deceased daughter, Barbara Katy.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A one-hour special that looks back at 2006, one of Dog's most tumultuous years, which has included the passing of Beth's father, Dog and Beth's wedding, the tragic death of Dog's daughter Barbara, and the sudden arrest of Dog, Tim, and Leland.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.desc: So what does a bondsman do when he learns that the felon he's bonded out is booked on an afternoon flight to Florida? Especially when over $140,000 is at stake? If you're Dog, you 911 the team and race to Honolulu International.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The animal kingdom is full of deadly predators, and some of them attack in extraordinary and inexplicable ways; some animals strike back at humans for reasons beyond normal defense and hunger.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: More than 80% of the Earth's oceans remain unexplored, and in many ways, the underwater world is the final frontier; as new technology allows people to explore oceans and deep lakes more than ever before, nobody knows what they will find.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Examining various events that are said to have been directed by the hand of the Almighty, such as the Great Flood, the Plagues of Egypt, Sodom and Gomorrah, and Moses parting the Red Sea.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout human history, many cultures have used sacred rituals to express their spiritual beliefs; there are many rituals that are thought to unlock supernatural powers.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: During World War II, a number of persistent mysteries were born, including unexplained stories about everything from lost gold to secret societies and highly advanced technology.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: There's nothing more fascinating than a code that can't be cracked. For centuries, mankind has devised ingenious ways to hide valuable information--using everything from enigmatic puzzles, to complex ciphers and secret symbols. If history's unbreakable codes can be deciphered...could we unlock answers to some of the greatest mysteries of both the past and present?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Since the dawn of humanity, tales of monstrous creatures lurking in the shadows have sparked both fascination and fear; discussing the potential that these stories have elements of reality to them.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: An Arkansas State Trooper is shot and killed after pulling over a van for a traffic violation. Officers apprehend the shooter, after a car chase and shootout. ATF is alerted when officers find weapons and explosives in the man's vehicle. Further testing of the weapons reveals one was used in a murder several months earlier. ATF traces some of the firearms to purchases made by another man from and arms dealer. They also match silencer marks from the weapons to a third man previously arrested for stealing a flatbed truck.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In January 1984, a U.S. Customs official disappears from his post near the Del Rio, Texas border crossing, prompting local police to search for four Latin American suspects driving a Pontiac Grand Prix. The following day, the Customs official was found dead. Two state troopers recovered the missing officer's service revolver after a fatal altercation with two men. Local police and the FBI continued searching for the suspect vehicle, prepared for a confrontation with desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. Fingerprints from the victim identify a recent escapee from a minimum-security prison, as well as his girlfriend. Investigators flag the dead man's credit cards, and are alerted when one is used in North Dakota. The FBI is called in and joins another task force already assembled because of a suspected kidnapping.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: This is the story of the FBI's first capture of an international Lebanese terrorist. In June 1985, the terrorist and his four accomplices hijacked Royal Jordanian flight #405 shortly before take off in Beirut, Lebanon. On board were American citizens, a professor and his teen son. The FBI opened a criminal investigation and worked with various other government agencies to form Operation Goldenrod, a task force specifically charged with bringing the terrorist to justice in 1989.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A California bank manager panics and calls in the FBI after the door to his vault refuses to open. Upon inspection, the vault has been blasted into from the ceiling, and over $2 million in valuables is gone. When agents find no clues as to the robbers or their whereabouts in California, they send details of the crime to other FBI field offices. It is not long before agents in Ohio are investigating a bank vault robbery that is strikingly similar to the California heist.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 1970s, the FBI had a working knowledge of anti-Castro terrorists operating in the United States. But then a new group appeared, more violent and aggressive than their predecessors. All agents had to go on was a series of chilling phone calls, a mysterious voice, and the threat of more violence. FBI field offices from New York to Miami coordinated their efforts, determined to catch the vicious killers.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, violent militants are intent on turning the US Commonwealth into a communist dictatorship. They murder a policeman, turns their guns on a busload of unarmed Navy workers, and even launch an attack on the FBI. These ruthless killers have vowed to fight to the death. The FBI must use every tactic at their disposal to track down the terrorists and bring them to justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 90s, a gang based in the U.S. Virgin Islands began smuggling thousands of kilos of cocaine into mainland America. Police and federal agents target the gang, but its leader remains a mystery. In an investigation spanning from Georgia to South America, local police, the DEA, U.S. Customs and the FBI work together to take down this dangerous drug gang.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. The bomb is the largest explosive device the FBI has ever seen. Detonation would be a disaster. Agents and bomb experts must disarm the deadly device, and stop the dangerous extortionist who built it.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On October 2, 1987, a Boston police officer responding to a domestic disturbance call was fatally wounded. Local authorities launched a citywide manhunt, but were only able to find the fingerprints of the chief suspect. Believing that he had fled the area, the FBI followed the suspect's trail to the west coast and then across the Mexican border, always aware of the desperation of a cop killer and of the need for justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In rural Texas, 13-year-old is kidnapped on her way to school. Frantic to find her safely, her millionaire father calls local authorities and the FBI. As police officers and agents conduct aerial surveillance, the father drives hundreds of miles through the night to deliver the ransom cash to a drop that the kidnappers keep changing. In a final effort to save the young girl, investigators must engage in a dangerous firefight with five desperate criminals.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1996, a group of political extremists twice robbed a bank in Spokane, Washington, using homemade bombs and military precision to escape. The FBI learned that the robbers, part of a shadowy organization called the Phineas Priesthood, might be preparing for a small-scale war with law enforcement. After the suspects were identified, the FBI was faced with the task of safely arresting a group of terrorists with a deadly agenda.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: After a career criminal committed a vehicular homicide in New Orleans, FBI agents tracked him through his habits and addictions. They focused their investigation on gambling communities throughout the country and, when he resurfaced in Atlantic City, authorities used all of their resources to trap an elusive sociopath who claimed that he would never be taken alive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A New Jersey State Trooper is shot to death on the side of Interstate 80 near the Pennsylvania border. Witnesses to the shooting identify the shooter's car. Police issue an APB, and locate the vehicle hours later. Fingerprinting of the vehicle points to a fugitive wanted on bank robbery charges. Authorities who inspect the fugitive's home find some incriminating evidence including a box of bullets linked to the Trooper's murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the 1970's, Otpor, a violent arm of the Croatian National Resistance commits terroristic acts against non-supportive Croatians living in the U.S. With the help of an informant, the FBI is able to apprehend, arrest and convict members of the group for crimes ranging from conspiracy and extortion to murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In New York, the FBI and local police join forces to battle the constant influx of Colombian cocaine into the city's ports. One detective goes undercover, posing as a Mafia wise-guy, and infiltrates a drug gang connected to Pablo Escobar's Medellin cartel. The detective must be bold, but cautious, taking on the role of a tough-guy, but always aware that if the gang suspects anything, they won't hesitate to kill him.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Henderson, NV, a suburb of Las Vegas, two robbers brandishing assault rifles ambush armored guards as they exit their truck on March 3, 2000. The robbers kill both guards and seize $5,000. As the killers run to their getaway car, a police officer arrives and opens fire, striking one escaping assailant in the leg. After loosing the killers in a chase, police collect blood left by the injured robber and bullet casings from the firefight.

FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In August 1984, the son of a successful real estate developer was kidnapped in front of his father's business in Miami. After the father received a $3 million ransom demand from a self-proclaimed terrorist, the FBI became involved. Based on witness descriptions of the car used in the kidnapping, authorities began to suspect a pair of Colombian nationals with a known grudge against the developer's family.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In June 1973, a young girl was abducted from a state park on the Missouri River while camping with her family. Several months passed with no leads, then an FBI agent took a particular interest in the case. Using a new technique known as criminal profiling, he predicted that the kidnapper would contact the girl's family on the one-year anniversary of her abduction. When this prediction came true, the FBI agent noted behavioral clues, hoping that they could lead him to the kidnapper.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, extortionists plant a thousand pound bomb in a Nevada casino and demand millions of dollars, or they will detonate the device. programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Puerto Rico, the death of a government witness, and the suspicious circumstances surrounding it, lead the FBI and local authorities to suspect corruption in the highest levels of the police force. With the help of a cooperating witness, investigators find the scope of the corruption is far greater that they first thought. Authorities struggle to capture the rouge officers, men who once swore to uphold the law, but now use their power to commit heinous crimes.

programme.desc: A man is found suffocated in his Pennsylvania home, his checkbook, credit cards and vehicle appear to have been stolen. programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Georgia, a series of bizarre shootings terrorizes the town of East Point. Two people are killed, and two are critically wounded. At first the shootings seem targeted, then they seem random. As the body count climbs, the killer taunts law enforcement with mysterious notes. Agents believe the shooter will continue until he is deador behind bars.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a rash of home invasion robberies take place in the metropolitan Detroit area. The thieves turn out to be part of a local gang dubbed the Home Invaders. Their crimes extend to insurance fraud, theft, and illegal lottery schemes. The Violent Crimes Task Force (VCTF) opens an investigation, and with the cooperation of a gang member who was apprehended at the scene of a crime, they are able to obtain the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 16 gang members.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the late 80's, Florida's cocaine imports were among the highest in the nation. Regional territories were enforced with intimidation and murder. Desperate to stop the violence, local authorities turned to the FBI for help. One dealer bowed to no one. He would stop at nothing to keep detectives and agents from building a case against him. When his organization began targeting the government itself, a city went on high alert.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When two women from the same town were murdered in the same way, police feared a serial killer was on the loose. At first they thought the victims had nothing in common until they found tiny clues linking them to the same man.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young couple decided to celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a camping trip to Mount Hood. During the trip, the husband was shot and killed, and his wife told two different versions of the events which led to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 3-year-old son of parents in Dripping Springs, Texas develops a respiratory condition. Then the father develops signs of Alzheimer's disease, and an investigator reveals that their ill health is due to a form of black mold in their modern home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A go-go dancer told her family she needed to get away for a while, and then she simply disappeared. Investigators were suspicious, because she took neither her car nor her clothes. 20 years later, her family received a call that changed everything.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A retired police officer is discovered in his bed, dead from a single gunshot wound to the head. His wife first says the motive was robbery. Then she tells police he committed suicide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An Alaskan police officer found a woman's body while on routine patrol of a public park. The victim had been stabbed to death and, during the autopsy, the medical examiner preserved the portion of her rib cage which sustained the fatal wound.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two sets of scientists probe a woman's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The sensitive nose of a forensic examiner sniffs out murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The news of a flight attendant's brutal murder prompted the son of a victim who had been killed five years earlier to contact police. Both murders had similar MOs, and analysis of biological evidence proved that these were serial killings.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the 2002 DC area shooting spree that resulted in ten murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of the kidnapping of a prominent banker's wife led police on a wild goose chase. An unexpected discovery made by an entomologist led to a new suspect, and the realization that ordinary office equipment can leave extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two sets of scientists probe a woman's death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Using an anonymous letter and geographical profiling, investigators close in on a serial rapist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at a trio of unsolved murders that occurred in Wichita Falls, Texas during the 1980s, details how a fourth murder from the same time period provided the police with more than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The police investigate when a severed leg is discovered in the garbage. Conventional means of identifying the victim are impossible, leading investigators to rely on DNA, forensic anthropology and toxicology to identify the victim.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bruce Miller was shot to death in the office of the junkyard business he owned. The crime scene was almost pristine. When a computer forensics expert examined the computers owned by the victim's wife and her lover, he found all the evidence needed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teen was killed by her parents in what they said was self-defense, but forensic evidence told otherwise.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman was found dead on a golf course in the Bahamas. The grass on that course was so distinctive, it had evidentiary value. The evidence led police to two suspects. Each blamed the other, and they had to find out who the killer was.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: No one in a quiet residential community saw anything unusual the day one of their neighbors was brutally attacked and murdered. Fingerprints found at the crime scene and surveillance video helped investigators to apprehend the presumed killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: With no forensic evidence inside a murder scene, investigators were baffled. But they suspected that the victim's dog had witnessed the crime. If she had, forensic scientists would have to find a way to find out what the dog had seen.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a man is gunned down in his own garage, police discover that a wound sustained by the grieving widow may have been self-inflicted. They turn to science to help unravel a twisted tale of lust, greed and deception.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a brutal attack on two boys near a pond relies on evidence fished out of the murky water. It was the first case where Diatom evidence was used to place a suspect at the scene of the crime.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In Pennsylvania 1984, a passer-by finds the torso of a woman in a cardboard box. Investigators rely on insect activity analysis by a forensic entomologist to determine when the murder victim was killed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The story of firefighter Michelle Baker is related. After meeting Dr. Maynard Muntzing, she became pregnant by him. After this news, she was ill whenever they were together. The coincidences led her to suspect that he was doing her harm.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Time of death becomes pivotal after a pregnant woman is found murdered in her air-conditioned bedroom. A striking similarity between her death and an HBO movie gives examiners the clues they need to thaw out the alibi of a cold-blooded killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The founder of American Atheists disappeared in 1995 along with one of her sons and granddaughter, along with $500,000 in gold coins. The police homed in on several suspects, including David R. Waters, who worked for American Atheists.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For six years, a serial killer prowled the streets of New York City. He wrote letters to police and The New York Post, indicating he would kill twelve people, one for each astrological sign.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman's death in Pennsylvania triggers a homicide investigation into another woman's death in North Carolina. The similarities in the cases were striking, and examiners must determine if the suspect's story about accidental drowning is all wet.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The decomposed body of a young woman was discovered in a Bakersfield irrigation canal. If there was trace evidence, it had been washed away.¾

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A brilliant young architect became ill and died just before she was to testify in a criminal trial. The autopsy revealed she'd been poisoned with arsenic. Investigators had to determine which person who knew her had a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A serial arsonist was on the loose in Washington, DC. Each of the fires was started with the same type of incendiary device. It was up to forensic scientists to find the clues that lay in the ashes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Police were puzzled by an obscure print found at a crime scene where one man had been killed and two teenage girls were seriously injured. Neither of the girls could identify their attacker. But one simple clue helped track the footsteps of a killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the Amtrak Railroad experienced the deadliest train crash in United States history when the Sunset Limited derailed while crossing Alabama's Big Bayou Canot bridge. Forty-seven passengers and crew were killed; scores more were injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A college student was found dead, and the evidence suggested he knew his killer. Three hairs and some microscopic cells helped police to unravel a web of lies, and find the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An examination of the 2002 DC area shooting spree that resulted in ten murders.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensics hopes to determine if this was revenge when the home of a state's witness is bombed, killing his father.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Doctors cannot pinpoint the source of a businessman's illness.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A go-go dancer told her family she needed to get away for a while, and then she simply disappeared. Investigators were suspicious, because she took neither her car nor her clothes. 20 years later, her family received a call that changed everything.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two men were murdered while sleeping in their beds. The next night, arson destroyed a family planning clinic. Investigators wonder whether some shards of glass, paint chips and a chicken feather could link what appeared to be two separate crimes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1984, California firefighters had battled ten arson fires in three weeks. When cigarettes and a scrap of paper connected the southern California fires to several fires further north, the hunt was on for a dangerous pyromaniac.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman disappears without a trace. Even though foul play is suspected, the leads don't pan out and the trail turns cold. Twenty years would pass before police are able to link a clump of hair discovered in an isolated area with the missing woman.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The disappearance of Philadelphia college athlete Aimee Willard is investigated after her car was found on the roadside. When her body is found, the police find unusual marks on her body and DNA evidence that eventually lead to her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A beautiful young woman fell to her death from a cliff overlooking the ocean. Initially, investigators thought it was a tragic accident. But after a forensic examination, police had a very different picture of what happened.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. programme.desc: A beautiful nursing student is found shot to death inside her car. But this young lady isn't exactly what she seems, and soon detectives are knee deep in uncharted investigative territory, where sexual secrets explode with deadly consequences.

programme.desc: When a series of brazen, armed robberies strike local businesses in a tranquil community in Wisconsin, detectives find themselves with few clues to help them identify the perpetrators. programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A gifted high school cheerleader�s bright plans for the future turn dark when she falls in love with an up-and-coming rapper and ex-con. Before long, she finds herself going down a road to trouble by hiding her relationship and risking her future in order to appease her man.

programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A beautiful young bank teller falls head over heels for a starving musician. Under his spell, she becomes willing to risk it all.

programme.title: For My Man

But when her man falls into the street life after losing his job, he pulls her down with him. programme.title: For My Man
programme.desc: A young dancer believes she’s found her soulmate when she meets a handsome man who promises to make her a star. Desperate to earn his love, she makes a deal with the devil – and for a shot at the spotlight it will cost her body and her soul.

programme.title: ATL Homicide
programme.desc: Shots ring out and leave a man dead. Quinn and Vince learn that this house on a quiet street was actually involved in the local drug trade, leaving detectives wondering if this is a case of a disgruntled customer or something more sinister.

programme.title: ATL Homicide
programme.desc: A young man is killed in a complex in Dixie Hills. Quinn and Vince are unable to identify their victim and have little to go on. Detectives receive a tip about a teen with a violent past and a penchant for bragging about his more murderous exploits.

programme.title: Payback

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

With news making executives, officials and thought-leaders from the world of business, politics and academia we will explore a story through probing interviews and nuanced conversations. The hour of programming will also highlight the most relevant stories from India which is currently one of the hottest investment destinations, but also has compelling stories that play into the Bloomberg's priority issues such as Climate change, Diversity and Technological innovation.

programme.title: Bloomberg Horizons Middle East & Africa
programme.desc: A spotlight on the fast paced growth and major deals happening across the Middle East and Africa. Linking the market drivers from overnight in the US and across Asia into the region's trading day, with deep dive analysis of the top business, energy and geopolitical stories shaping the decisions of traders across the Middle East, Africa and beyond.

programme.title: Bloomberg Daybreak: Europe
programme.desc: From London, essential morning viewing to stay ahead of the day's market trends with news stories from the U.S. and Asia in the lead-up to the opening of European markets.

programme.title: Bloomberg The Opening Trade
programme.desc: The Opening Trade has everything you need to know as markets open across Europe. With analysis you won't find anywhere else, we break down the biggest stories of the day and speak to top guests who have skin in the game. Hosted by Anna Edwards, Guy Johnson and Kriti Gupta.

programme.title: The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
programme.desc: Based in London, Francine Lacqua speaks with high-profile guests in the heart of global business, economics, finance and politics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Brief
programme.desc: "Bloomberg Brief" delivers the market news, data and analysis viewers need to set their agendas.

programme.title: Bloomberg Surveillance
programme.desc: Jonathan, Lisa and Annmarie survey the economy and global markets with daily conversations with leaders and decision makers, from Wall Street to Washington and beyond, to cover the latest in business, investment and geopolitics.

programme.title: Bloomberg Open Interest
programme.desc: Delivering the market-moving news anyone needs to know to get a jump start on the U.S. trading day.

programme.title: Bloomberg Tech
programme.desc: Bloomberg Tech is the only daily live technology program with a focus on breaking news, market-moving reporting and analysis of global technology companies and stories. The program brings the audience interviews from the biggest names in the business, offering in-depth analysis and critical insights.

programme.title: Bloomberg Markets
programme.desc: The most important global business and breaking markets news and information as it happens.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power

programme.title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily

programme.title: Bloomberg: The Close
programme.desc: Alix Steel, Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu own the market-moving breaking news around the closing bell; a synthesis of the top stories; key insights from investors, strategists and the companies of today and tomorrow.

programme.title: Bloomberg: Balance of Power
programme.desc: Focusing on the intersection of politics and global business.

programme.title: The Circuit

programme.title: Bloomberg The Asia Trade
programme.desc: Bloomberg The Asia Trade - bringing global investors everything you need to know as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers.

programme.title: Bloomberg Balance of Power

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin gets wedged in a wild Arkansas cave and Ryan can't help but laugh. Above ground, the team spreads kindness in a rural community, gives a man a guitar worth singing about, and Jimmy Luv finds courage to confess his crush to an Olympian.

programme.title: Heart Of New Hampshire
programme.desc: New Hampshire Tackles Hunger.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In Milwaukee, 19-year-old Sade Robinson has gone missing, and her car is found torched. A trail of evidence across the city shocks the community and leaves her family searching for justice.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Her groundbreaking book and lasting legacy.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: East Kingston's Kingswood Polo Club becoming hub for state's growing polo community.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this season's finale, Frank Nicotero finds a couple of good sports in New Orleans and Cincinnati. Watch as he revisits the most absurd moments from the first two seasons.

programme.title: Neighbors Helping Neighbors at the Maryland Food Bank
programme.desc: The Maryland Food Bank is fighting hunger with innovation, farms, mobile markets, culinary training, and volunteers—proving what’s possible when communities come together.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: A passionate beekeeper in Omaha, and a Pittsburgh based seasoned mosaic artist.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: The Valley Originals restaurants donate hundreds of thousands of dollars back into community each year.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: With a lump of clay and a vision, Manchester ceramics artist Monica Leap empowers and builds community connections through pottery.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: You can feel the love on this week’s culinary showdown. Chef Amy Mehrtens, Executive Chef of Copper Vine, challenges long-time friend Chef Daren Porretto, Chef de Cuisine at Saint John. While these two go back years, when it comes to competition they’re pulling no punches.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: After making two of the last three state championships St John’s Prep High School is on a mission to defend their reputation. A down-to-the-wire controversial call will decide their fate in the 2024 tournament.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A Missouri community seeks answers when two young women disappear a decade apart

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A fugitive escapes through the ceiling. A man plows his car into the police station. These shocking stories prove cops don't even have to leave the building to encounter the unpredictable.

programme.title: Mo Gaba: Spirit Lives Forever
programme.desc: How a child living with cancer changed the Baltimore sports community forever.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Hang with a viral sensation in his taxidermy workshop. Watch a bakery turn into a Burmese restaurant. Load up a picnic basket with chicken and ‘dippity dips.’ Drink all the wines, and then sip on what a local calls a ‘sober-up beer.’

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Whether it's a wrestling star training through grief, champion rollerskaters challenged on the world stage, or a cycling team pushing through obstacles, Iowans don't back down when the going gets tough.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: For one weekend in June, Keene was taken over by face-painted tigers and safari-like parades as part of a celebration to mark 30 years since the movie "Jumanji" was filmed there.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Group in New Hampshire finding strength through rowing during cancer recovery.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Two couples browse farmers markets, rock out, and volunteer their time with the birds and the bea-gles on cheap dates in Orlando.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: With a lump of clay and a vision, Manchester ceramics artist Monica Leap empowers and builds community connections through pottery.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: We've got Tech N9ne, the legendary artist who wrote 'KCMO Anthem,' DeJuan Bonds, the barber for the Kansas City Chiefs, and Lisa Peña, a local guide who believes KC is best viewed by foot. You don't want to miss their recommendations!

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: From inventors to marathon runners, interesting people are all over the country.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Veteran NYC Chef Ten Vong squares up against Jimmy's Famous Seafood rep Charlie Wickboldt. Watch these chefs transform their colorful careers into even more colorful plates. Who will find the tomato trophy at the end of the rainbow?

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption
programme.desc: (2019) Juvenile Lifers: Road to Redemption focuses on people who were sentenced to life in prison as juveniles. WGAL News 8's Matt Barcaro examines how these these former offenders are re-entering society and the reaction from victims' families.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: New Hampshire Chronicle highlights the people and places that make the Granite State so special. Presented by WMUR.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Unbelievable
programme.desc: Brace yourself for heart-stopping heroics as rescuers leap into action! A semi-truck teeters dangerously over the Ohio River, a devastating gas explosion reduces homes to rubble, and a capsized cargo ship leaves its crew fighting for survival.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Searching for Johnny
programme.desc: (2022) The disappearance of Johnny Gosch is one of Iowa's longest running, and most notorious mysteries. In 1982, the 12-year-old paperboy in West Des Moines vanished without a trace. Forty years later, KCCI uncovers where the investigation stands.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: New Hampshire Chronicle highlights the people and places that make the Granite State so special. Presented by WMUR.

programme.title: Ora 4X: Behind the Smiles
programme.desc: Two patients. One life-changing choice. With a wedding fast approaching, Nicole’s racing to restore her smile. After years of struggle, Jared’s reclaiming his life and his confidence. Watch how Ora 4X transforms futures, one smile at a time.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: New Hampshire Chronicle highlights the people and places that make the Granite State so special. Presented by WMUR.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Esquire’s Dave Holmes chats with Gaten Matarazzo from Stranger Things and shares an Esquire-approved itinerary for your next trip to Boston.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Jason Taylor and Adam Stayrook will have to chef to impress in today’s Date Night Delights challenge. Will their fancy meals delight the judges? Or will this be a date they wanna forget?

programme.title: Silver Linings
programme.desc: Welcome to Lancaster, PA, one of the country's hottest retirement hubs. Here, seniors, from a beauty pageant queen to a 90 year-old swim champion aren’t slowing down; they’re rewriting the playbook and redefining aging in America.

programme.title: WCVB Chronicle
programme.desc: Chronicle's award-winning team brings you the stories of New England.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: All across this country, people are stepping up to help their communities in big and small ways. From nurses, veterans and firefighters, to teachers, neighbors, and strangers, every community has a hero.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob tests out all types of relaxation, from sound baths to flinging an axe, discovers exciting new cuisine and quenches his thirst in this diverse and hopping Boston ‘hood.

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet the Boston Junior Rangers, one of the most elite teams in the Eastern Hockey League. With a reputation for producing top NHL prospects, these new recruits must prove they can live up to the Junior Rangers standard.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: Host Frank Nicotero asks contestants questions about the wildest, wackiest news stories. In "Peculiar Properties," he quizzes locals about a house shaped like apparel, a teeny tiny house and a basement with a shocking surprise.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: The crew’s 30-day kindness blitz brings joy to packed crowds and local communities, serving up French toast, tipping drive-thru heroes, mowing a random lawn and capping it off with a solo show on a dedicated fan's doorstep.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A beloved University of Kentucky football player is murdered on the porch of his house during his 21st birthday party in an assassination-style killing. What leads to the shooter's capture is equally shocking.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From a dance instructor who prioritizes mental health for her students, to a high school baseball coach who exemplified courage, KC athletes show off their formulas for success.

programme.title: Game Gone Wild: The Socker Slam Story
